sentence: Booming demand for goods and the strength and speed of the reopening have led to shortages and bottlenecks, leaving the COVID-constrained supply side unable to keep up.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: The result has been elevated inflation in durable goodsâ€”a sector that has experienced an annual inflation rate well below zero over the past quarter century.1 Labor market conditions are improving but turbulent, and the pandemic continues to threaten not only health and life, but also economic activity.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: In my comments today, I will focus on the Fed's efforts to promote our maximum employment and price stability goals amid this upheaval, and suggest how lessons from history and a careful focus on incoming data and the evolving risks offer useful guidance for today's unique monetary policy challenges.

sentence: As is typically the case, the recovery in employment has lagged that in output; nonetheless, employment gains have also come faster than expected.4 The economic downturn has not fallen equally on all Americans, and those least able to shoulder the burden have been hardest hit.

sentence: The job of monetary policy is to promote maximum employment and price stability as the economy works through this challenging period.

sentence: The Path Ahead: Maximum Employment The outlook for the labor market has brightened considerably in recent months.

sentence: The levels of job openings and quits are at record highs, and employers report that they cannot fill jobs fast enough to meet returning demand.

sentence: These favorable conditions for job seekers should help the economy cover the considerable remaining ground to reach maximum employment.

sentence: The unemployment rate has declined to 5.4 percent, a post-pandemic low, but is still much too high, and the reported rate understates the amount of labor market slack.5 Long-term unemployment remains elevated, and the recovery in labor force participation has lagged well behind the rest of the labor market, as it has in past recoveries.
label: LABEL_1

sentence: With vaccinations rising, schools reopening, and enhanced unemployment benefits ending, some factors that may be holding back job seekers are likely fading.6 While the Delta variant presents a near-term risk, the prospects are good for continued progress toward maximum employment.

sentence: Inflation at these levels is, of course, a cause for concern.

sentence: The dynamics of inflation are complex, and we assess the inflation outlook from a number of different perspectives, as I will now discuss.

sentence: Durable goods alone contributed about 1 percentage point to the latest 12â€‘month measures of headline and core inflation.

sentence: It seems unlikely that durables inflation will continue to contribute importantly over time to overall inflation.

sentence: But if wage increases were to move materially and persistently above the levels of productivity gains and inflation, businesses would likely pass those increases on to customers, a process that could become the sort of "wageâ€“price spiral" seen at times in the past.10 Today we see little evidence of wage increases that might threaten excessive inflation (figure 6).

sentence: Our monetary policy framework emphasizes that anchoring longer-term expectations at 2 percent is important for both maximum employment and price stability.

sentence: The prevalence of global disinflationary forces over the past quarter century Finally, it is worth noting that, since the 1990s, inflation in many advanced economies has run somewhat below 2 percent even in good times (figure 7).

sentence: The pattern of low inflation likely reflects sustained disinflationary forces, including technology, globalization and perhaps demographic factors, as well as a stronger and more successful commitment by central banks to maintain price stability.13 In the United States, unemployment ran below 4 percent for about two years before the pandemic, while inflation ran at or below 2 percent.

sentence: To sum up, the baseline outlook is for continued progress toward maximum employment, with inflation returning to levels consistent with our goal of inflation averaging 2 percent over time.

sentence: Let me now turn to how the baseline outlook and the associated risks and uncertainties figure in our monetary policymaking.

sentence: Implications for Monetary Policy The period from 1950 through the early 1980s provides two important lessons for managing the risks and uncertainties we face today.
label: LABEL_2

sentence: The early days of stabilization policy in the 1950s taught monetary policymakers not to attempt to offset what are likely to be temporary fluctuations in inflation.15 Indeed, responding may do more harm than good, particularly in an era where policy rates are much closer to the effective lower bound even in good times.

sentence: The main influence of monetary policy on inflation can come after a lag of a year or more.

sentence: The 1970s saw two periods in which there were large increases in energy and food prices, raising headline inflation for a time.

sentence: That brings me to a concluding word on the path ahead for monetary policy.
